reviewText: This pseudo-documentary looks like a film student's first project.  The cinematography is abominable, the content is weak, and in general it's pretty god-awful.  Don't bother.

Great film about the Chicago music scene.  Red Red Meat and The Jesus Lizard footage is worth any price.

The director was not Wolfgang peterson, I believe it was Scott Peterson.
Very interesting insight into the Chicago music scene during the mid nineties.
